Articles.Content:
Here is a link to a list of mods that was started by @nismobg back in 2013 and has been updated over time as mods were updated to work with various versions of KSP with which they are likely to work: 

 

Spoiler

I haven't seen a list of mods compatible, or updated for the official 1.1 release yet. If it exists I'll delete or modify this post to include it's link. If it doesn't exist, if anyone thinks it'd be a good idea (I know a lot of mods are using "[1.1]"  in the title, so thats pretty obvious ) I guess I can go ahead and make a list like I did for the pre-release. With a few rules however. The mods that are added have to be links to preferably the mods forum page, or at least some place that is the main page for the mod (github etc), not a link to a google drive or similar link that will change with each update. This will help prevent the need for updating the list all the time. Also, I would like to ask that if you are the mods creator to send me a PM with the link to your mod(s), and I'll add them to the list when I can. 

Now, if it is a mod that the developer hasn't updated in awhile, and the community has taken it into their own hands to update it for 1.1, I would prefer that a forum page be used to link to it, and at least with a note that it is not the work of the original author and that it is a fix by the community, if not a slightly different name. If someone submits a community fix for a mod, and the original mod developer doesn't want it listed, they can message me directly and I will remove it from the list.

 

Edited April 26, 2016 by Sma
This list already exists in the Pre-release modding section.
@Nansuchao He probably knows as sma is the one who posted that list in the pre forums...

1 hour ago, Nansuchao said:

This list already exists in the Pre-release modding section. 

Pre-release forums have been locked.
Just my 2 cents, but now that 1.1 is official, CKAN will update pretty quickly. I'm not sure what benefit keeping a separate list would bring.

19 minutes ago, MalevolentNinja said:

Just my 2 cents, but now that 1.1 is official, CKAN will update pretty quickly. I'm not sure what benefit keeping a separate list would bring.

Not all mods make it to CKAN.  Some people don't use CKAN. Some people may want to install a mod before it goes on CKAN.

1 hour ago, Torgo said:

Not all mods make it to CKAN.  Some people don't use CKAN. Some people may want to install a mod before it goes on CKAN. 

+1 for people not using CKAN.

Now back to the OP, while I understood the usefulness of such a thread for the prerelease, now we have got official 1.1, this whole subforums itself is a list of mods stating for which version they are.

2 hours ago, MalevolentNinja said:

Just my 2 cents, but now that 1.1 is official, CKAN will update pretty quickly. I'm not sure what benefit keeping a separate list would bring.

CKAN breaks my game, as I do a lot of custom moding of parts and I hate it fighting with me and restoring mods to 'default' state. no thanks.

On 20.4.2016 at 9:21 AM, vardicd said:

CKAN breaks my game, as I do a lot of custom moding of parts and I hate it fighting with me and restoring mods to 'default' state. no thanks.

I act same like you - have a bunch of self-adjusted configs. 

In the first days of CKAN it also breaks saves (not the configs) on my side.

Meanwhile i make backups (of KSP-, GameData- and/or Saves-Folder) BEFORE i update by CKAN.

Rarely some mods act strange after updating, so i can move it back to "Live"-Game.
For OSX, ckan requires installing the Mono framework. I'm not a developer, it's a extremely heavy install that gobbles up limited SSD space and has zero other purpose for me. No thanks
I have had to remove a few posts, please use the quote system responsibly.

On 4/20/2016 at 2:16 AM, merlinux said:

+1 for people not using CKAN.

Now back to the OP, while I understood the usefulness of such a thread for the prerelease, now we have got official 1.1, this whole subforums itself is a list of mods stating for which version they are.

Maybe, I just find it annoying to search through 4 or 5 pages to find which of my mods have updated, and thought it would be easier with a list. How ever as @frostsid mentioned, there is a list already thats being updated.

On 4/20/2016 at 0:21 AM, MalevolentNinja said:

Just my 2 cents, but now that 1.1 is official, CKAN will update pretty quickly. I'm not sure what benefit keeping a separate list would bring.

As others have said, not everyone uses CKAN, for one reason or another, so thats where a separate list comes in.

On 4/21/2016 at 11:52 AM, frostsid said:

Check this list.

Cool thanks, I'll check with the person who made that post and check if they're ok with me sharing their link at the top of my post.
